body:
### Description

Hi,

I used this plugin for long time ago, but now it's starting to give me problems.
Things that change, I only can think in the  project size that now is 200M.
I'm in Ubuntu22, but I recently change, and before I work with Ubuntu18 and 20, that has the same problem... yes, I change twice my S.O. in one year.

I started to see that when I try things like 'go to definition', it takes like a minute (when it works), and see lot of errors like 'Client n quit with exit code n and signal n' (the numbers change so I put an 'n')
And another thing I notice is that node starts to give me some problems, because ubuntu tell me to send the report.

I follow the README and install with basic configuration. Commenting code here and there I discover the line that give me problems.
I tried to look where node is launch, and without that line, node doesn't start:
`lspconfig.pyright.setup {}`
with the line node starts with:
CPU: 190,7
MEM: 13,8
(more or less)
The problem with node apparently is a resource problem, so maybe it's getting too much resources with the basic configuration.

### Neovim version

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-698+g02d859a07
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info


### Nvim-lspconfig version

_No response_

### Operating system and version

Ubuntu22

### Affected language servers

python

### Steps to reproduce

Install plugin with Suggested configuration

### Actual behavior

It takes some minutes to 'go to definition'
node stop working


### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Minimal config

```Lua
-- Setup language servers.
local lspconfig = require('lspconfig')
lspconfig.pyright.setup {}
lspconfig.tsserver.setup {}
lspconfig.rust_analyzer.setup {
  -- Server-specific settings. See `:help lspconfig-setup`
  settings = {
    ['rust-analyzer'] = {},
  },
}


-- Global mappings.
-- See `:help vim.diagnostic.*` for documentation on any of the below functions
vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>e', vim.diagnostic.open_float)
vim.keymap.set('n', '[d', vim.diagnostic.goto_prev)
vim.keymap.set('n', ']d', vim.diagnostic.goto_next)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>q', vim.diagnostic.setloclist)

-- Use LspAttach autocommand to only map the following keys
-- after the language server attaches to the current buffer
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('LspAttach', {
  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('UserLspConfig', {}),
  callback = function(ev)
    -- Enable completion triggered by <c-x><c-o>
    vim.bo[ev.buf].omnifunc = 'v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc'

    -- Buffer local mappings.
    -- See `:help vim.lsp.*` for documentation on any of the below functions
    local opts = { buffer = ev.buf }
    vim.keymap.set('n', 'gD', vim.lsp.buf.declaration, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', 'gd', vim.lsp.buf.definition, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', 'K', vim.lsp.buf.hover, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', 'gi', vim.lsp.buf.implementation, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-k>', vim.lsp.buf.signature_help, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wa', vim.lsp.buf.add_workspace_folder, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wr', vim.lsp.buf.remove_workspace_folder, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wl', function()
      print(vim.inspect(vim.lsp.buf.list_workspace_folders()))
    end, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>D', vim.lsp.buf.type_definition, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>rn', vim.lsp.buf.rename, opts)
    vim.keymap.set({ 'n', 'v' }, '<space>ca', vim.lsp.buf.code_action, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', 'gr', vim.lsp.buf.references, opts)
    vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>f', function()
      vim.lsp.buf.format { async = true }
    end, opts)
  end,
})
```


### LSP log

comment_data.body:
> I used this plugin for long time ago, but now it's starting to give me problems.

"This plugin" is just a collection of configs. Problems with whatever LSP server are running have nothing to do with this plugin.

> Things that change, I only can think in the project size that now is 200M.

This plugin is just a collection of configs. If pyright or whatever LSP server is having problems, you need to resolve that with pyright or whatever LSP server.

title: ubuntu out of memory with node
